intro: Tardavel, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, bushy perennial with a rosette of leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, white, and pink, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Tardavel thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
